JobFullDesc: Are you interested in applying your engineering skills to turn the emerging and disruptive technologies of today into the hardware and systems infrastructure of the future? Microsoft’s Cloud business is experiencing explosive growth, and it is the Azure Hardware Systems and Infrastructure (AHSI) organization that is responsible for enabling the infrastructure underlying this growth.  AHSI is a relatively young organization that was formed in December 2019 with the merger of Azure Hardware Systems Group and Capacity, Supply Chain and Provisioning, and we are responsible for building the hardware roadmap for the evolution of Azure’s datacenter infrastructure.  AHSI is responsible for hardware strategy and planning across multiple time horizons (0-1, 2-3, and 4-5+ years) and delivering hardware infrastructure into today’s datacenters, while also ensuring we have a resilient supply chain to scale Azure.  We are responsible for understanding what it means to evolve the datacenter, and have groups actively working on hardware solutions not only for today’s classical workloads, but also hyperscale workloads that will require artificial intelligence supercomputers and the quantum computing systems of the future. We are looking for a Principal Optical Systems Engineer to join our multi-disciplinary team working on cloud data storage technologies for the future.  Your creativity and imagination will be put to good use as you discover and overcome the challenges encountered when pioneering new technologies and applying known technologies in novel ways. As a Principal Optical Systems Engineer, you will partition the optical system into functional blocks and collaborating across a diverse set of disciplines in the fields of engineering and physics to ensure the key functional and performance requirements for each block are identified and specified.   You will share in the responsibility of optimizing the system to achieve the best outcomes for our customers and our business while leading the optical development team.  ResponsibilitiesLeading the systems engineering for future optical storage systems, including design partitioning and preparation of system block diagramsCreation of architecture and design requirements documentation, including specification of interfaces, and behavioral and functional requirementsOptimization of optical component and control processes to maximize the system-level performanceLead and manage the team comprised of both internal and external resources to execute on the
